column6: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 5. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:

column2: 7. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:

column6: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.

column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 9. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
10. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 21. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column6: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
a low place in the road.

column2: 23. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 24. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
